DOC.brief_summary: - Objectives : The primary objective study evaluate safety early discharge strategy patient low risk ST-elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) , treat primary percutaneous coronary intervention ( PPCI ) , compare conventional strategy . - Methodology : Unicentric , randomize , control , non-inferiority open label clinical trial . The investigator compare early discharge strategy ( ≤72 hour ) conventional strategy ( discharge accord treat physician 's criterion ) . Inclusion criterion : low risk ( Zwolle risk score ≤3 ) STEMI treat PPCI within 24 hour symptoms onset . Exclusion criterion : arrhythmia ( ventricular tachycardia fibrillation , asystole , pulseless electrical activity , advance atrio-ventricular block ) , mechanical complication ( cardiac tamponade , free-wall septal rupture , acute mitral regurgitation , pericarditis ) , severe moderate bleeding ( accord GUSTO criterion ) , complication relate vascular access procedure , acute kidney failure , infection , heart failure . Sample size 1558 subject ( n=779 per group ) . The investigator study demographic , clinical , biochemical , echocardiographic angiographic variable . The primary endpoint composite death , reinfarction , new angina , heart failure , ventricular arrhythmia , stroke severe bleeding . The secondary endpoint include item primary endpoint quality life functional capacity questionnaire SF-36 . Finally , investigator analyze degree compliance European Society Cardiology guideline STEMI rate hospitalization-related complication . Follow 30 day .
